name: Janus Words Quiz | Word Play | 10 Questions

questions.text: After you _____ off the excess branches, you will be able to _____ the Christmas tree with ornaments.
questions.explanation:
trim.

	"Trim" means both "to remove" (the branches) and "to add" (the ornaments.)

questions.text: After everyone else had _____ for the day, Karl was the only one _____  at work.
I was in a real _____ when my car broke down, but luckily the mechanic was able to _____ the problem.
questions.explanation:
fix.

	A "fix" is both a problem and its solution.

questions.text: I had to _____ the table before I could put the cake on it and _____ it with powdered sugar.
questions.explanation:
dust & make.

	"Dust" means both "to remove powder" and "to add powder."

questions.text: Although it __________ candy for many years, the vending machine __________ and stopped working.
questions.explanation:
gave out.

	"Gave out" means both "produced something" and "stopped producing something."

questions.text: Although the pitcher _____ from the team due to his loss of ability, he changed his mind and _____ for the new season.
questions.explanation:
resigned.

	"Resigned" means both "quit a contract" and "resumed a contract."

questions.text: Ever the irreverent type, Claudia proclaimed that the papal _____ was a bunch of _____.
questions.explanation:
bull.

	"Bull" applies to both a solemn and important document and a worthless one.

questions.text: The imposing granite cliff had _____ many a storm, but was being _____ away by the implacable forces of the ocean waves.
questions.explanation:
weathered.

	"Weathered" means both "held up" and "wore away."

questions.text: Once it was no longer _____ by rope, the deer was able to _____ away in huge leaps.
questions.explanation:
bound.

	"Bound" means both "held in place" and "to move."

questions.text: His motivation was _____; he wanted to make colored glass that was _____ and easy to see through.
questions.explanation:
transparent.

	"Transparent" means both "easy to see" and "hard to see."
